Our Project Plans

We’ve got some very ambitious goals. We need your help to create a dramatic positive impact in the next decade. We want to create businesses to:

  • Accelerate consumer uptake in substainable products and services.
  • Commericalise substainable innovations and technology.
Accelerate the uptake of renewable energy to 50-70% of our energy mix globally by 2030.

Electricity generation is globally the biggest contributor to CO2 emissions. Consumers are looking for alternatives as electricity prices increase. There are no technical barriers to achieving secure, reliable power from a very high proportion of renewable energy. Let’s Make One are working to overcoming the consumer and business barriers to dramatically increase the uptake of renewable and stimulate a large renewable market.

Accelerate the uptake of electric and carbon neutral vehicles to 50-70% of all vehicles globally by 2030.

Transport is the second biggest polluter globally. Petrol and diesel vehicles are also inefficient with much of the energy being wasted as heat. Electric Cars(EV’s) today are meeting and exceeding the capabilities of petrol vehicles. Consumer want to buy EV’s but the purchasing cost and access to charging infrastructural holds them back. We’ve got some fresh ideas that we are planing to pilot and test the business case on.

Increase the efficiency of recycling and improve the market for recycled material.

From plastics bottles to clothes, manufacturing waste to household waste, there is some much more we could be reusing. Many countries haven’t scratched the surface on recycling. We believe there is an untapped market for recycled material using new recover techniques and fresh business thinking.

Remove of the majority of single use plastics from the consumer supply chain globally.

Plastic waste is having serious impact on our food chain, ecosystem and waterways. Single use plastic are one of the worst offenders. Consumer studies show that given a viable alternative, people are happy to do away with plastic. Let’s Make One is looking at ways to scale alternative sustainable packaging or deliver meathods reduce the need for packaging on a massive scale.

“Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.”

- Margaret Mead
